plants.description: Eucalyptus is a genus of over 700 species of flowering trees and shrubs in the myrtle family, Myrtaceae. Most species are native to Australia, but some are found in New Guinea, Indonesia, and the Philippines. Eucalyptus trees are known for their aromatic leaves and distinctive bark. They are widely cultivated for timber, essential oils, and landscaping.

plants.name: Extinguisher moss
plants.description: Extinguisher moss is a common name for species in the Encalypta genus, which belongs to the Encalyptaceae family of mosses. These mosses are widespread and can be found in various habitats, including soil, rocks, and tree trunks. Encalypta mosses are small and inconspicuous, with capsule-like structures that resemble extinguishers, hence the common name.

plants.name: Eytelia
plants.description: Eytelia is a genus of flowering plants in the Asteraceae family, native to North America. It comprises two species of perennial herbs that grow in desert regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Eytelia plants have small yellow flowers and linear leaves. They are adapted to arid environments and are often found in sandy or rocky soils.

plants.name: Fair-maid-of-France
plants.description: Fair-maid-of-France, also known as sneezewort, is a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family, native to Europe and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in damp meadows, marshes, and along riverbanks. Fair-maid-of-France has clusters of white or pale pink flowers and aromatic foliage. It has been used in traditional medicine and as a garden ornamental.

plants.name: Fellenwort
plants.description: Fellenwort, also known as bittersweet nightshade, is a species of flowering plant in the Solanaceae family, native to Europe and Asia. It is a perennial vine that grows in a variety of habitats, including woodlands, hedgerows, and disturbed areas. Fellenwort has purple flowers and red berries that are toxic if ingested. Despite its toxicity, the plant has been used in traditional medicine.

plants.name: Felonwood

plants.name: Boston fern or sword fern
plants.description: Boston fern, also known as sword fern, is a species of fern in the Nephrolepis genus, native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is one of the most popular ferns grown as a houseplant due to its graceful arching fronds. Boston ferns are commonly used as ornamental plants in gardens, landscapes, and indoor spaces. They prefer moist, humid environments with indirect light.

plants.name: Christmas fern
plants.description: Christmas fern is a species of fern in the Polystichum genus, native to eastern North America. It is named for its evergreen fronds, which are often used in holiday decorations. Christmas ferns are commonly found in woodlands, rocky slopes, and ravines. They are valued for their ornamental foliage and are sometimes cultivated for landscaping and naturalizing.

plants.name: Coast polypody
plants.description: Coast polypody is a species of fern in the Polypodium genus, native to western North America. It is commonly found in coastal forests, rocky cliffs, and other humid habitats. Coast polypody has evergreen fronds with deeply lobed leaflets. It is often used as a ground cover in shaded areas and is valued for its ornamental foliage.

plants.name: Kimberly queen fern
plants.description: Kimberly queen fern is a cultivar of Nephrolepis obliterata, a species of fern native to Australia. It is known for its upright growth habit and compact form, making it well-suited for containers and hanging baskets. Kimberly queen ferns have dark green fronds with gracefully arching tips. They are popular ornamental plants for shady gardens, patios, and indoor spaces.

plants.name: Korean rock fern
plants.description: Korean rock fern is a species of fern in the Polystichum genus, native to East Asia. It is commonly found growing on rocky slopes, cliffs, and forested areas. Korean rock fern has glossy, dark green fronds with triangular leaflets. It is valued for its ornamental foliage and is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant in temperate regions.

plants.name: Mosquito fern
plants.description: Mosquito fern is a species of aquatic fern in the Azolla genus, native to the Americas. It is commonly found floating on the surface of slow-moving or stagnant water bodies, such as ponds, lakes, and marshes. Mosquito ferns form dense mats that provide habitat for small aquatic organisms. They are often used in freshwater aquaria and as green manure in rice paddies.

plants.name: Sword ferns
plants.description: Sword ferns are a group of fern species in the Polystichum genus, characterized by their evergreen fronds with elongated leaflets resembling swords. They are native to various regions of the world and are commonly found in forests, woodlands, and rocky slopes. Sword ferns are valued for their ornamental foliage and are popular choices for landscaping and naturalizing.

plants.name: Water fern
plants.description: Water fern is a species of aquatic fern in the Azolla genus, native to the Americas. It is commonly found floating on the surface of slow-moving or stagnant water bodies, such as ponds, lakes, and marshes. Water ferns form dense mats that provide habitat for small aquatic organisms. They are often used in freshwater aquaria and as green manure in rice paddies.

plants.name: Western sword fern
plants.description: Western sword fern is a species of fern in the Polystichum genus, native to western North America. It is commonly found in forests, woodlands, and shaded ravines. Western sword fern has large, dark green fronds with elongated leaflets. It is valued for its ornamental foliage and is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant for landscaping.

plants.name: Feverbush
plants.description: Feverbush, also known as winterberry or Michigan holly, is a species of holly native to eastern North America. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows in wetland habitats, such as swamps, bogs, and floodplains. Feverbush is valued for its bright red berries, which persist through the winter and provide food for birds. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental landscaping.

plants.name: European flax
plants.description: European flax, also known as common flax or linseed, is a species of flowering plant in the Linaceae family, native to the Mediterranean region. It is cultivated for its fiber and seeds, which are used to make linen fabric, linseed oil, and food products. European flax is an annual herbaceous plant with slender stems and blue flowers. It has been cultivated for thousands of years for its versatile uses.

plants.name: New Zealand flax
plants.description: New Zealand flax is a species of flowering plant in the Phormium genus, native to New Zealand and Norfolk Island. It is cultivated for its fiber, which is used to make rope, mats, and textiles. New Zealand flax has long, sword-like leaves and produces tall flower spikes with red or yellow flowers. It is a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes.

plants.name: Fluxroot
plants.description: Fluxroot, also known as butterfly weed or butterfly milkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the Apocynaceae family, native to North America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in prairies, meadows, and along roadsides. Fluxroot has vibrant orange flowers that attract butterflies and other pollinators. It is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and as a nectar source for butterflies.

plants.name: Yellow fumewort
plants.description: Yellow fumewort is a species of flowering plant in the Papaveraceae family, native to Europe and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in woodlands and shady habitats. Yellow fumewort has delicate yellow flowers and finely divided leaves. It is valued as an ornamental plant for its early spring blooms and fern-like foliage.

plants.name: Gallberry
plants.description: Gallberry is a species of holly in the Aquifoliaceae family, native to the southeastern United States. It is an evergreen shrub that typically grows in wetland habitats, such as swamps, bogs, and marshes. Gallberry has glossy, dark green leaves and produces small white flowers that give way to black berries. It is valued for its ornamental foliage and is sometimes used in landscaping and holiday decorations.

plants.name: Garget
plants.description: Garget, also known as American pokeweed or pokeberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Phytolaccaceae family, native to North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in fields, meadows, and disturbed areas. Garget has large, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white flowers followed by dark purple berries. While parts of the plant are toxic, it has been used in traditional medicine and as a source of dye.

plants.name: Golden garlic
plants.description: Golden garlic is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family, native to Europe and North Africa. It is a bulbous perennial that typically grows in rocky habitats and grasslands. Golden garlic has yellow flowers arranged in umbels atop slender stems. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant for its bright blooms and deer-resistant properties.

plants.name: Wild garlic
plants.description: Wild garlic, also known as Canada garlic or meadow garlic, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family, native to North America. It is a bulbous perennial that typically grows in moist meadows, prairies, and woodland edges. Wild garlic has clusters of white to pinkish flowers and onion-like bulbs. It is sometimes used as a culinary herb and has a garlic-like flavor.

plants.name: Garlic mustard
plants.description: Garlic mustard, also known as Jack-by-the-hedge or hedge garlic, is a biennial or perennial herb in the Brassicaceae family, native to Europe and western Asia. It is an invasive species in many parts of North America and other regions. Garlic mustard has small white flowers and triangular to heart-shaped leaves with a garlic-like odor when crushed. It outcompetes native plants and is considered a problematic weed in natural habitats.

plants.name: Rogue's gilliflower
plants.description: Rogue's gilliflower is a common name for Hesperis matronalis, a species of flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Eurasia and has been introduced to other regions as an ornamental plant. Rogue's gilliflower has clusters of fragrant purple or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms and sweet scent.

plants.name: Winter gilliflower
plants.description: Winter gilliflower is a common name for Hesperis matronalis, a species of flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Eurasia and has been introduced to other regions as an ornamental plant. Winter gilliflower has clusters of fragrant purple or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms and sweet scent.

plants.name: Golden buttons
plants.description: Golden buttons is a common name for Tanacetum vulgare, a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and Asia and has been introduced to other parts of the world. Golden buttons has bright yellow, button-like flower heads that bloom in summer. It is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.

plants.name: Goldenglow
plants.description: Goldenglow is a common name for Rudbeckia laciniata, a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to eastern North America and is known for its tall stature and bright yellow flowers with brown centers. Goldenglow blooms in late summer to early fall and is valued for its ornamental beauty. It is commonly cultivated in gardens and landscapes.

plants.name: Golden Jerusalem
plants.description: Golden Jerusalem is a common name for Rudbeckia hirta, a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to North America and is known for its bright yellow flowers with dark brown or black centers. Golden Jerusalem blooms from summer to fall and is valued for its ornamental beauty. It is often cultivated in gardens, wildflower meadows, and along roadsides.

plants.name: Gordaldo
plants.description: Gordaldo is a common name for Achillea millefolium, a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and Asia and has been introduced to other regions. Gordaldo has clusters of small white flowers and finely divided leaves. It is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in herbal medicine for various purposes.

plants.name: Goose tongue
plants.description: Goose tongue is a common name for Achillea ptarmica, a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and Asia and has been introduced to other regions as an ornamental plant. Goose tongue has clusters of white flowers and lance-shaped leaves. It is sometimes cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine for its medicinal properties.

plants.name: Grapefruit
plants.description: Grapefruit is a citrus hybrid believed to be a cross between the sweet orange (Citrus sinensis) and the pomelo (Citrus maxima). It is known for its large size, sour to semi-sweet taste, and characteristic aroma. Grapefruits are commonly eaten fresh, juiced, or used in salads and desserts. They are also rich in vitamin C and are popular for their health benefits.

plants.name: Grapevine
plants.description: Grapevine is a genus of flowering plants in the Vitaceae family, native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It includes around 60 species of woody vines known for their edible fruit, grapes. Grapevines are cultivated worldwide for winemaking, fresh fruit consumption, and ornamental purposes. They are valued for their climbing habit and attractive foliage.

plants.name: Groundberry
plants.description: Groundberry is a common name for Rubus hispidus, a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to North America and is known for its trailing habit and prickly stems. Groundberry produces small white flowers followed by edible red berries that are enjoyed by wildlife and sometimes used by humans for jams and pies. It is often found in woodland habitats and along forest edges.

plants.name: Bristly groundberry
plants.description: Bristly groundberry is a common name for Rubus hispidus, a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to North America and is known for its trailing habit and prickly stems. Bristly groundberry produces small white flowers followed by edible red berries that are enjoyed by wildlife and sometimes used by humans for jams and pies. It is often found in woodland habitats and along forest edges.

plants.name: Gutweed
plants.description: Gutweed is a common name for Sonchus arvensis, a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and Asia and has been introduced to other regions. Gutweed is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows in disturbed habitats, agricultural fields, and along roadsides. It has yellow flowers and deeply lobed leaves. Gutweed is considered a weed in crop fields.

plants.name: Haldi
plants.description: Haldi, also known as turmeric, is a flowering plant of the ginger family, Zingiberaceae. It is native to the Indian subcontinent and Southeast Asia and is widely cultivated for its rhizomes, which are used as a spice, medicine, and as a dye. Haldi has a long history of use in traditional medicine, particularly in Ayurveda and traditional Chinese medicine, where it is believed to have anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.

plants.name: Rock harlequin
plants.description: Rock harlequin, scientifically known as Corydalis sempervirens, is a species of flowering plant in the Papaveraceae family. It is native to eastern North America and is commonly found in rocky habitats, hence its common name. Rock harlequin produces clusters of delicate, tubular flowers that vary in color from pale pink to lavender. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in rock gardens and woodland landscapes.

plants.name: Yellow harlequin
plants.description: Yellow harlequin, scientifically known as Corydalis flavula, is a species of flowering plant in the Papaveraceae family. It is native to eastern North America and is commonly found in wooded areas, stream banks, and rocky slopes. Yellow harlequin produces clusters of bright yellow flowers with spurred petals. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in shaded gardens.

plants.name: Hay fever weed
plants.description: Hay fever weed, also known as ragweed, refers to plants in the Ambrosia genus, particularly Ambrosia artemisiifolia, and sometimes Artemisia trifida. These plants are native to North America and are notorious for producing pollen that triggers allergic reactions in many people, causing hay fever. Hay fever weed is considered an invasive weed in some areas and is a major contributor to seasonal allergies.

plants.name: Healing blade
plants.description: Healing blade is a common name for Plantago major, a species of flowering plant in the Plantaginaceae family. It is native to Eurasia but has been introduced to other regions worldwide. Healing blade is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine to treat various ailments. It produces distinctive lance-shaped leaves and spikes of small flowers and is sometimes cultivated for its medicinal value.

plants.name: Hedge plant
plants.description: Hedge plant, scientifically known as Maclura pomifera, is a species of flowering plant in the Moraceae family. It is native to North America and is commonly found in prairies, woodlands, and along stream banks. Hedge plant is valued for its dense, thorny branches, which make it an effective hedge or barrier plant. It produces greenish-yellow, grapefruit-sized fruits that are inedible for humans but are attractive to wildlife.

plants.name: Hellebore
plants.description: Hellebore is a genus of perennial flowering plants in the Ranunculaceae family, native to Europe and Asia. It includes several species commonly known as hellebores or Lenten roses. Hellebores are valued for their early spring blooms and evergreen foliage, making them popular ornamental plants in gardens and landscapes. However, many species contain toxic compounds and should be handled with care.

plants.name: American white hellebore
plants.description: American white hellebore, scientifically known as Veratrum viride, is a species of flowering plant in the Melanthiaceae family. It is native to North America and is commonly found in wet meadows, marshes, and stream banks. American white hellebore produces tall spikes of white flowers and has large, ribbed leaves. It contains toxic alkaloids and should be handled with caution.

plants.name: Big hellebore
plants.description: Big hellebore, scientifically known as Veratrum viride, is a species of flowering plant in the Melanthiaceae family. It is native to North America and is commonly found in wet meadows, marshes, and stream banks. Big hellebore produces tall spikes of white flowers and has large, ribbed leaves. It contains toxic alkaloids and should be handled with caution.
